title: 888 raises the stakes in Bwin bidding war
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Sep 1, 2015, 09:06 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 24 mins 888 raises the stakes in Bwin bidding war By Ben Martin | Telegraph – 12 minutes ago 0.0001 0.0000 
888 has raised its bid for Bwin in an attempt to see off rival suitor GVC 
Online gambling company 888 has upped the stakes in its £1bn takeover battle with GVC by raising its bid for Bwin.Party. 
Bwin, which offers poker, bingo and sports betting online, revealed on Tuesday that 888 had made a revised takeover proposal and that it was now evaluating the bid. It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) must weigh the offer against a competing proposal submitted by Sportingbet owner GVC, which is gate-crashing a deal already agreed between Bwin and 888. 
The latest twist in the takeover saga marks a success for Bwin’s board, which has effectively engineered a bidding war between 888 and GVC . 
Although Bwin recommended an £898.3m cash-and-paper offer from 888 in mid-July, rival suitor GVC refused to concede defeat and made a takeover proposal worth about £1bn last month. 
Bwin’s board and shareholders had some concerns with GVC’s bid, but the company kept the takeover battle alive by working with the latter gambling group to iron out those problems. Once the worries were overcome, Bwin last Thursday incited another round of bids from both suitors by inviting GVC to make a formal offer on its “best terms”. 
Bwin, which has been up for sale since last November, said it would now consult with its “key shareholders” over coming days to decide which of the two proposals is in investors’ “best interests”. 
The terms of 888’s revised approach were not disclosed, although Bwin said that it came with “a number of pre-conditions”. GVC is understood to have made its latest bid on Friday evening.
